head.title: Add Metadata to {{EXT}} Files in {{ProgLang}} {{ProductName}} Applications
head.description: {{ProgLang}} {{ProductName}} metadata processing API to add metadata information to {{EXT}} files. Work with metadata standards XMP, EXIF, IPTC, ID3 etc.

header.title: Adding Metadata To {{EXT}} In {{ProgLang}}
header.description: Add custom metadata properties to a wide range of business documents, images, audio & video file formats using {{ProductFullName}} API.

about.title: About {{ProductFullName}} API
about.h1: [{{ProductFullName}}]({{slash_lang}}/metadata/{{ProductCode}}/) offers an advanced set of metadata management and manipulation features, allowing .NET programmers to easily view, edit, delete, find, compare, swap and export metadata information from images and document formats without using any external software. Add metadata details to PDF, Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, OneNote, Visio, Project, AutoCAD, Archive and Multimedia file formats with additional support to perform metadata operations on any {{ProductName}}-based applications with true flexibility.

steps.title_left: Steps for adding Metadata to {{EXT}} in {{ProgLang}}

content_left.description: [{{ProductFullName}}]({{slash_lang}}/metadata/{{ProductCode}}/) makes it easy for {{ProductName}} developers to add metadata details to {{EXT}} files from within their applications by implementing a few easy steps.
content_left.step_1: Load the {{EXT}} file to be updated.
content_left.step_2: Specify a predicate that will be used to add metadata properties.
content_left.step_3: Pass the predicate to the AddProperties method.

content_right.description: {{ProductFullName}} APIs are supported on all major platforms and operating systems. Before executing the code below, please make sure that you have the following prerequisites installed on your system.
content_right.step_1: Operating Systems: Microsoft Windows, Linux, MacOS
content_right.step_4: Download the latest version of {{ProductFullName}} from [{{RepoName}}]({{RepoUrl}})

code.add_comment: add a property containing the content author
